descript.abstract: Cadastral data for the City of Brockton, Massachusetts compiled from city tax maps and assessing data. Updated in January 2019

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: City of Brockton, CDM Smith, MassGIS, Tighe & Bond

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

attracc.attraccr:
Total number of parcels = 25203 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct
Total number of records in assessor table = 27338 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 25073 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 25030 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.83 pct High value match rate passes QA.
Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 2265 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 2253 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 99.47 pct Low value match rate passes QA.
Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... ------------------------------------------------------------------- Required match rate for 25203 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 25100 Of these, 24993 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.57 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.srccontr: Parcel boundaries were digitized in 2012 from the 182 existing scans of the hard copy Assessor's Tax Maps. Parcels were linked to the existing CLT assessing database.

procstep.procdesc: Data was processed to meet MassGIS Level III formatting standards including reviewing the city boundary and adding standard fields and definitions. Gaps representing street ROWs were filled in as per the Level III requirements. Data was updated using information provided by City of Brockton through 1/1/2016 and in January 2019

overview.dsoverv: Parcel boundaries were digitized from the Assessor's182 100-scale tax maps. Parcel identifiers were linked to the City's CLT assessing system. To meet MassGIS Level III parcel standards, parcel boundaries were reveiwed against the ROWs and other features shown on the MassGIS 2008/2009 orthophotos. Data was updated using information provided by City of Brockton through 1/1/2016.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.0.
http://www.mass.gov/mgis/standards.htm#Parstandard

cordsysn.projcsn: 1983 Massachusetts Mainland State Plane Coordinate System, FIPS 2001, US Feet

cntorgp.cntorg: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

onlinopt.accinstr: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm
distinfo.resdesc: M044TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Brockton that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M044Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M044OthLeg and M044Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

onLineSrc.orDesc: M044TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Brockton that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M044Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M044OthLeg and M044Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.
Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

LegConsts.othConsts: Access constraints: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
Use constraints: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

Consts.useLimit: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.
Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.6 pct

Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

prcStep.stepDesc: Data was processed to meet MassGIS Level III formatting standards including reviewing the city boundary and adding standard fields and definitions. Gaps representing street ROWs were filled in as per the Level III requirements.

dataSource.srcDesc: Parcel boundaries were digitized in 2012 from the 182 existing scans of the hard copy Assessor's Tax Maps. Parcels were linked to the existing CLT assessing database.
